item.title: PARKING BRAKE LIGHTS – Park Brake Light – Anti-skid Operative

numlitem.para: Parking brake valve is operative, and
Anti-skid light is verified to be operative once each flight day.
When releasing parking brakes, verify that anti-skid indicator light on P5 panel extinguishes.
If the anti-skid light remains illuminated, the flight may be dispatched with the anti-skid system inoperative. See MEL item 32-44-3-1-2.

placard.para: Placard PARK BRAKE Light on control stand "LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)
PARK BRAKE indicator light may be inoperative continuously extinguished or continuously illuminated.

numlitem.para: Check that parking brake valve operates normally:
Check that wheels are chocked.
Provide electrical power.
Provide right hydraulic system pressure.
Close PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Close IND LTS 1 circuit breaker (11P1).

warning.para: DOOR LOCKS MUST BE PROPERLY INSTALLED PRIOR TO ACCESS TO PARKING BRAKE VALVE (REF. MAINTENANCE MANUAL 32-00-15). RAPID ACTION OF DOORS MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF LOCKS ARE NOT PROPERLY INSTALLED.

numlitem.para: Gain access to valve, located on forward bulkhead of right main gear wheel well.
Set parking brakes and verify that valve visual position indicator is at POS 2 (closed).
Release parking brake and verify that valve visual position indicator moves to POS 1 (open).
If PARK BRAKE indicator light is continuously illuminated, proceed to Step 3.
If PARK BRAKE indicator light is continuously extinguished, check that ANTI-SKID indicator light monitor of parking brake valve is operational by performing the following:
Set Parking brakes.
If ANTI-SKID indicator light on P5 illuminates, perform the following:
Open PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify the ANTI-SKID indicator light extinguishes.
Close PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify that ANTI-SKID light illuminates after approximately 3 second delay.
Position and hold CONFIG TEST switch on the accessory panel, panel P61, to T/O.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message is displayed in EICAS.
Release parking brakes.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message extinguished.
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light extinguishes.
Release CONFIG TEST switch.
Proceed to Step 4.
If ANTI-SKID indicator on P5 does not illuminate, perform the following:
Open PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light is illuminated.
Close PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light extinguishes.
Position and hold CONFIG TEST switch on the accessory panel, panel P61, to T/O.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message is displayed on EICAS.
Release parking brakes.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message extinguishes.
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light is extinguished.
Release CONFIG TEST switch.
Proceed to Step 4.
If PARK BRAKE indicator light is continuously illuminated, perform the following:
Set parking brake.
Open PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light is illuminated.
Close PARKING BRAKE VLV circuit breaker (6F4).
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light extinguishes.
Position and hold CONFIG TEST switch on the accessory panel, panel P61, to T/O.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message is displayed on EICAS.
Release parking brake.
Verify that PARKING BRAKE takeoff warning message extinguishes.
Verify that ANTI-SKID indicator light is extinguished.
Release CONFIG TEST switch.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
